learning_outcomes.description: Understand and analyse how an econometric result is stated and proved in an econometric research paper.
Assess how to apply an econometric result to data.
Evaluate how to interpret econometric results in view of applied economics.
Formulate how to be critical and deconstruct existing methodologies.

assessments.task_description:
The assignment will contain a set of practical and theoretical questions and cover topics from previous lectures. Answers including each question solution and computer output need to be provided.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The presentation will require reading a research paper and writing slides. The presentation will consist in presenting those slides in class.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The presentation slides need to be submitted to Blackboard by 29/10/2025 2:00 pm. Each student need to present their slides during the class time on 29/10/2025 (The class is scheduled between 2 and 5 pm).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
